title: God of War art director joins Naughty Dog following Netflix studio closure
description: Raf Grassetti - principal artist on 2018's God of War and, later, art director on its acclaimed sequel God of War Ragnarök - has announced he's starting a "new chapter" at The Last of Us developer Naughty Dog, following the closure of Netflix's "AAA" studio in October. Read more
author: Matt Wales

The Last of Us Part I

title: 10 Years Later, Bong Joon-Ho's Snowpiercer Is Finally Coming to 4K Blu-Ray
description: More than 10 years after it was first released, Snowpiercer is getting its very first 4K Blu-ray release. This new edition features a collectible steelbook case with all-new cover art. Preorders are live at Amazon ahead of its release on January 14, 2025, and you can secure your copy for just $35. Snowpiercer 4K Steelbook Edition $35 | Releases January 14, 2025 Along with the steelbook case, this new edition of Snowpiercer includes the movie in 4K, standard Blu-ray, and digital formats, along with the following special features:The Birth of SnowpiercerThe charactersAnimated prologueConcept art galleriesChris Evans and Tilda Swinton on SnowpiercerThe Train Brought To Life: Behind the scenes of a special screeningLe Transperceniage: From the blank page to the blank screen Preorder at Amazon Directed by Bong Joon-Ho and also starring Tilda Swinton, Ed Harris, Song Kang-Ho, Jamie Bell, Octavia Spencer, Go Ah-Sung, and John Hurt, the film was critically acclaimed when it was first released. Adapted from the French graphic novel Le Transperceneige by Jacques Lob, the film would eventually go on to inspire a TV series in 2020 that ran for several seasons. If you want to experience the source material, you can pick up the original Snowpiercer graphic novels in a bundle that includes all three books in hardcover format and three unique art cards for $60.22 (was $80) at Amazon.Snowpiercer was Bong's English language debut, and the South Korean filmmaker has since gone on to make several more critically acclaimed movies, including the dark comedy Parasite, which won the Oscar for Best Picture in 2020, making the first non-English language film to win that category. Some of his other films include the crime thrillers Memories of Murder and Mother, the 2006 monster movie The Host, and the sci-fi adventure film Okja. Despite the variety of genres he's explored, all of Bong's films feature similar themes of environmentalism and class conflict. If you're interested in diving into his work, several of his movies are available at Amazon, including multiple Criterion Collection editions.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: How Long Is Path Of Exile 2: Campaign Length And Quest List
description: Despite releasing into early access, Path of Exile 2 is filled to the brim with content. From the main story campaign to side bosses to an endless endgame, you're certainly getting your money's worth by participating in early access. Some players could find hundreds of hours of gameplay in Path of Exile 2 just through the game's initial content.However, if you're trying to gauge exactly how much time you have to spend in Path of Exile 2 before "beating it," that's another story. Below, you can find how long it takes to beat Path of Exile 2, how long it takes to reach the endgame, and a full quest list so you can track your progress.How long to beat Path of Exile 2Since Path of Exile 2 is an ARPG, you can never truly "beat it." Most ARPGs follow a similar structure of progressing through a main campaign that's followed by the endgame. The endgame is what you make of it and you could spend however much time you want with a given character participating in endgame content.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Suspect apprehended in UHC shooting was former Firaxis Games employee
description: On Dec. 4, a masked person shot UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson on the streets of Manhattan. On Monday, a McDonald’s employee in Pennsylvania spotted someone who resembled the shooter; that person, 26-year-old Luigi Mangione, has since been arrested, according to AP. Information about Mangione immediately circulated online, including his background in video game development and […]

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 860
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Where would you rather go on vacation: New Zealand, Alaska, Costa Rica or Switzerland? I’d love to go to all of these places, but right now Switzerland sounds pretty cool. 2. Ponytail or curls? Hmm. I like ponytails because they’re functional, but sometimes they give me a headache, so let’s go with curls. They’d have to be super loose ones, though. And kinda messy! 3. Did you ever have a job where you had to wear a uniform? Kinda. We had very specific guidelines for safety when I worked at the bakery, like close-toed shoes, no nail polish, hair tied back. 4. If you were in school, whom would you likely hang out with: the athletes, the drama crew, the band kids or the honors society? You’d[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 860 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 841
description: Seasons greetings! Hard to believe we’re in full-on Christmas season time now, isn’t it? Folks getting their tree (we did today!), putting up the Christmas lights (workin’ on it!), other decorations. I was looking back at December posts over the years, and when I came upon this one it made me smile. 🙂 Mt. Saint Tabby? That was SO Tabs. It was a quiet morning on our hill today. Nothing really exciting happened, except for some joggers running by, which made a certain someone’s tail poof up… While Tabs checked out the usual blades of grass, plants and trees, I spent some time thinking about how possessive and jealous Tabs gets now in his older age. And not just with his humans. He’s also like that with his domain outside. I may or may not have received a Post-It last week asking me to write the city about renaming our hill, “Mt. Saint Tabby,” because Tabs doesn’t like the thought of anybody, and by “anybody,” I mean any other cats, chilling on his hill. Your[Continue reading...] The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 841 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: "Winners do drugs after all" - you can rewrite your favourite game screens with this fun tool
description: Fancy taking the piss out of video games? Here you go, a fun little tool you can run in your browser easily lets you rewrite famous game quotes. The Death Generator offers a gallery full of (mostly) retro games and a simple text box that will replicate the exact font used by those games, all so you can make the little shopkeeper in Zelda say rude words, or entirely rewrite the pre-mission dossiers of Goldeneye 007. There's a lot more than that though. I've done a bunch, come see what I mean and have a go yourself. Read more
author: Brendan Caldwell
